org.gamelink.tournament

Class Scheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gamelink.tournament.Scheduler

  • public class Scheduler
extends java.lang.Object
    The Scheduler class is used to create a tournament structure for all matches to be played it ensures that every team plays every other team twice; once as player 1 and once as player 2

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Class<?>> algoList
      An ArrayList containing all user made classes.
      java.util.ArrayList<Match> matchList
      An ArrayList containing all the matches to be played in the tournament
      java.util.ArrayList<Team> teamList
      An ArrayList containing all the teams participating in the tournament

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Scheduler()
      The scheduler constructor initializes the tournament by creating all matches Teams and Algorithms and adding them to the corresponding ArrayList

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Class<?>> getAlgoList()
      retrieves the ArrayList of Algorithms to be used by the gamePlayers
      static int[][] getArray(int teams)
      Creates an array that is used for determining the teams in each match of the tournament
      java.util.ArrayList<Match> getMatchList()
      retrieves the ArrayList of Matches to be used by the gamePlayers
      static int getPrev(int[][] array, int i, int j)
      retrieves the previous cell in the array (the one to its left) to be used when rotating the array
      java.util.ArrayList<Team> getTeamList()
      retrieves the ArrayList of Teams to be used by the gamePlayers
      static int[][] rotateArray(int[][] array)
      Rotates the array clockwise so the next set of matches can be extracted
      void setAlgoList()
      Using the Spring Framework the setAlgoList initializes all user created Algorithm classes in the algorithms folder and adds them to the ArrayList algoList
      void setMatchList()
      fills the matchList ArrayList with all matches needed to be played throughout the tournament the number of matches is determined by the number of teams as each team must play each other twice
      void setTeamList()
      Creates a new team for every Algorithm class in the algoList ArrayList each Team is instantiated with the name retrieved from the corresponding user created Algorithm class

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • algoList

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Class<?>> algoList
        An ArrayList containing all user made classes. These classes contain the algorithms to be used in the playing of the matches in the tournament

      • matchList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Match> matchList
        An ArrayList containing all the matches to be played in the tournament

      • teamList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Team> teamList
        An ArrayList containing all the teams participating in the tournament

    • Constructor Detail

      • Scheduler

        public Scheduler()
        The scheduler constructor initializes the tournament by creating all matches Teams and Algorithms and adding them to the corresponding ArrayList

    • Method Detail

      • getAlgoList

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Class<?>> getAlgoList()
        retrieves the ArrayList of Algorithms to be used by the gamePlayers
        Returns:
        the ArrayList of Algorithms

      • getMatchList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Match> getMatchList()
        retrieves the ArrayList of Matches to be used by the gamePlayers
        Returns:
        the ArrayList of Matches

      • getTeamList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Team> getTeamList()
        retrieves the ArrayList of Teams to be used by the gamePlayers
        Returns:
        the ArrayList of Teams

      • setAlgoList

        public void setAlgoList()
        Using the Spring Framework the setAlgoList initializes all user created Algorithm classes in the algorithms folder and adds them to the ArrayList algoList

      • setTeamList

        public void setTeamList()
        Creates a new team for every Algorithm class in the algoList ArrayList each Team is instantiated with the name retrieved from the corresponding user created Algorithm class

      • setMatchList

        public void setMatchList()
        fills the matchList ArrayList with all matches needed to be played throughout the tournament the number of matches is determined by the number of teams as each team must play each other twice

      • getArray

        public static int[][] getArray(int teams)
        Creates an array that is used for determining the teams in each match of the tournament
        Parameters:
        the - number of teams participating in the tournament
        Returns:
        the array that is manipulated to determine the matches of the tournament

      • rotateArray

        public static int[][] rotateArray(int[][] array)
        Rotates the array clockwise so the next set of matches can be extracted
        Parameters:
        the - current configuration of the array
        Returns:
        the new configuration of the array

      • getPrev

        public static int getPrev(int[][] array,
          int i,
          int j)
        retrieves the previous cell in the array (the one to its left) to be used when rotating the array
        Parameters:
        the - current configuration of the array
        the - row that the cell lies on
        the - column that the cell lies on
        Returns:
        the value of the previous cell
